[[File:Grond - Livery of the Heirs of Elendil.png|right|200px]]
The '''livery of the heirs of Elendil''' was a black surcoat with an embroidered blossoming [[White Tree of Gondor|white tree]] beneath a silver crown and many-pointed stars.<ref name=MT>{{RK|MT}}, p. 753</ref>

At the time of the [[War of the Ring]] nobody, except the [[Guards of the Citadel]] wore it in [[Gondor]].<ref name=MT/>

== Standard of Elendil ==
The '''standard of Elendil''' was a banner attached to a staff with a version of the design of the livery of Elendil that was made by [[Arwen]] for [[Aragorn|Aragorn Elessar]].<ref>{{RK|Company}}, p. 775</ref> It had a black field,<ref>{{RK|Company}}, p. 789</ref> with a flowering white tree for Gondor, [[Seven Stars|seven stars]] wrought of gems about it, and a crown wrought of ''[[mithril]]'' and gold above it.<ref name=Battle>{{RK|Battle}}, p. 847</ref> These were the signs of the house of [[Elendil]], which Aragorn unfurled at the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]].<ref name=Battle/> The royal banner of Gondor had been black with a blossoming white tree beneath seven stars.<ref>{{App|Stewards}}, p. 1052</ref>
